intro: Psychotria dalzellii, commonly known as the Dalzell's psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
